title: Alleged body part theft by Harvard morgue manager spurs lawsuit
description: The manager allegedly sold body parts on the black market, prompting a lawsuit for negligence and emotional distress.

title: Report alleges ‘coup’ documents found on Bolsonaro aide’s phone
description: Bolsonaro aide Mauro Cid is accused of having 'gathered documents' to support a coup against Brazil's President Lula.

title: US energy dept got two ransom requests in data breach
description: DoE, which manages US nuclear weapons and nuclear waste sites related to the military, notified Congress of the breach.

title: US restricts Ugandan officials travel in wake of anti-LGBTQ law
description: US President Biden had previously said said cuts and sanctions were possible in response to the law.

title: Will Germany’s security strategy work?
description: Germany unveils its first national security strategy as it juggles relations with China.

title: Daniel Ellsberg,  Pentagon Papers whistleblower dies at 92
description: Ellsberg was famous for exposing government deception on the US war in Vietnam and advocated for whistleblower rights.

title: Mali asks UN to withdraw its peacekeeping mission ‘without delay’
description: The West African nation's military rulers criticised MINUSMA's 'failure' to respond to security challenges.

title: Russia announces opening of consular offices in West Jerusalem
description: Israel welcomes decision calling the move a diplomatic achievement.

title: Man found guilty in Pittsburgh synagogue attack that killed 11
description: A jury convicted Robert Bowers of all 63 counts related to a 2018 massacre, the deadliest attack on Jews in US history.

title: What did Putin say at Russia’s flagship economic forum?
description: Russian president touted resilient economy despite sanctions, said Ukraine's forces stood 'no chance' of winning war.

title: Search for loved ones, truth in Greece after migrant boat tragedy
description: Hundreds of people are missing after a refugee-filled vessel capsizes off Greece's west coast, killing dozens.

title: Chinese President Xi meets Bill Gates, calls him ‘an old friend’
description: Xi stressed US-China cooperation in meeting with Gates saying common development should be the aim, not hegemony.

title: Suspect in Nottingham attack charged with three counts of murder
description: Police said Valdo Calocane, 31, is also accused of three counts of attempted murder after a stabbing and van attack.

title: US DOJ :’systemic’ police problems led to murder of George Floyd
description: Report details abuses that targeted Black residents long before the May 2020 murder of Floyd captured world's attention.

title: The real problem with Israel’s ‘collective punishment’
description: The use of the term, while well-intended, ends up suggesting that it's only the 'collective' bit that's the problem.

title: Canada’s top court upholds STCA that sends asylum seekers to US
description: The Safe Third Country Agreement allows Canada to turn back most asylum seekers who come from the US.

title: Serbian court orders investigation of 3 jailed Kosovo policemen
description: Serbian Public Prosecutor's Office orders continued detention of policemen arrested this week in disputed circumstances.

title: In Russia, UAE leader calls for dialogue to end Ukraine war
description: As Putin is isolated by much of the world, Mohammed bin Zayed Al Nahyan meets the Russian president and lauds ties.

title: Mali divided before referendum vote to pave way for elections
description: The June 18 referendum could pave the way for presidential elections to hold in Mali in February 2024.

title: Iran’s Raisi secures array of agreements on Latin American tour
description: Ebrahim Raisi visits Venezuela, Nicaragua and Cuba, Tehran's three allies in the region, on five-day trip.

title: As Sudan war rages, rival sides accused of looting, diverting aid
description: Aid workers, medics and experts say army and RSF both steal aid, restrict access and impose rent-seeking impediments.

title: Rights, press bodies slam Pakistan crackdown on ‘critical voices’
description: At least seven journalists and political commentators charged with sedition and other offences in the past week.

title: Fears of environmental disaster mount after Ukraine dam break
description: An estimated 700,000 people are in need of clean water around the Nova Kakhovka dam as Kyiv speaks of ‘ecocide’.

title: Swiss cyclist dies after fall into ravine during Tour de Suisse
description: Gino Mäder, 26, dies from injuries a day after crashing and falling down a ravine during the Tour de Suisse race.

title: India court bars airing of Al Jazeera documentary
description: Media network's film, India ... Who Lit the Fuse?, investigates hate crimes by Hindu nationalist groups against Muslims.

title: ‘She clung to the children’: Nigeria boat tragedy survivors mourn
description: Survivors and relatives are mourning the deaths of 106 people in a boat tragedy on June 12 after a large wedding party.

title: Timeline: How the migrant boat tragedy unfolded off Greece
description: Greek authorities say they were notified of the boat's presence but those onboard repeatedly refused offers for help.

title: UK ex-police watchdog chief charged with raping teenage girl
description: Michael Lockwood's charges include six counts of indecent assault and three offences of rape against a girl.

title: Explosions hit Kyiv as African leaders begin ‘peace mission’
description: The leaders also plan to visit Russia, as a diplomatic standoff brews between South African officials and Poland.

title: India minister’s house set ablaze in ethnic violence-hit Manipur
description: Junior Foreign Minister R K Ranjan Singh's office confirms a mob vandalised and set fire to his house in capital Imphal.

title: Protesters in Lebanon vandalise banks, demand their money back
description: People demand the return of their savings and call for officials involved in corruption to be held accountable.

title: Virgin Galactic plans first commercial space flight this month
description: Virgin Galactic has sold about 800 tickets over the past decade, with the initial batch going for $200,000 each.

title: Pakistan to host Asia Cup cricket with Sri Lanka to placate India
description: The compromise is aimed at forestalling a tit-for-tat boycott by India which is hosting the World Cup later this year.

title: India police say five ‘foreign’ fighters killed in Kashmir
description: Officials claim the fighters were killed in a gunfight along the de facto border with neighbouring Pakistan.

title: Cyclone Biparjoy disrupts power, kills two in India and Pakistan
description: Thousands without power as the severe cyclone makes landfall and heavy rains lash both the Indian and Pakistani coasts.

title: Protests across Greece as hope to find shipwreck survivors fades
description: Greek authorities have been criticised for not acting to rescue hundreds as their boat sank off the coast of Pylos.

title: Why is US Secretary of State Antony Blinken going to China?
description: Expectations are modest for Beijing and Washington in attempt to improve relations after a particularly bumpy year.

title: FIFA chief wants refs to stop football games when racism occurs
description: FIFA chief Gianni Infantino says 'zero tolerance' approach must be taken when racism happens in matches at all levels.

title: Three dead, dozens hurt as tornado devastates Texas town in US
description: The tornado moved through a mobile home park, mangling trailers and uprooting trees, according to a witness.

title: World breaks average temperature record for June: EU
description: EU Copernicus Climate Change Service says start of June saw global surface air temper break heat records for the period.

title: Why do US sanctions fail? Because a platypus isn’t a bird
description: Sanctions mostly cause humanitarian crises, not democratisation. The answer lies in biology.

title: US military chief says Ukraine offensive a ‘very difficult fight’
description: US General Mark Milley says Ukraine making 'steady progress' in counteroffensive that is 'very violent' and costly.

title: Seoul salvages part of rocket from North Korea’s failed launch
description: Pyongyang attempted to send its first military spy satellite into orbit last month, but the rocket crashed into the sea.

title: Mixed martial arts fighter Conor McGregor in sexual assault claim
description: The former UFC star is alleged to have assaulted a woman in a toilet at an NBA final, the woman's lawyer says.

title: At least 15 killed, 10 injured in bus crash in Canada’s Manitoba
description: The accident happened when a small bus and truck collided at a highway junction and the bus caught fire.

title: Russia-Ukraine war: List of key events, day 478
description: As the war enters its 478th day, these are the main developments.

title: Torture used by Russian forces in Ukraine may be state policy: UN
description: UN Special Rapporteur on Torture Alice Jill Edwards said widespread use of torture by Russian forces appears deliberate.

title: Nine women file Nevada sexual assault lawsuit against Bill Cosby
description: Complaint was filed after Nevada passed a law lifting the statute of limitations for civil cases about sexual assault.
